comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Washington herald. (Washington, D.C.), 12 Dec. 1915, page 18, right-hand column, under Norfolk Navy Yard label chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045433/1915-12-12/ed-... reports that Mr and Mrs. Frederick Barrett had recently attended the marriage of their niece Julia Littell to Lieut. Alexander McCarrell Patch. Her husband is therefore en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Patch but the wikipedia entry does not cover his personal life.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.geni.com/people/Julia-Patch/6000000015614953496 indicates that Julia Adrienne Patch (Littell) was born in 1893 and that they had a son, Alexander M. Patch III, in 1920. But it provides no other details for her. What could be this photo is in The Day book. (Chicago, Ill.), 06 Aug. 1915. LAST EDITION, Image 23 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045487/1915-08-06/ed-... announces the engagement and indicates that her parents are Col. and Mrs. I.W. Littell.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From NYT of November 22, 1945 (needs subscription) select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60917FA3D5B1073... General McCarrell died of pneumonia on Nov. 21, 1945. She was still alive and they were still married. Their son had died in action in France in 1944. They had a daughter, also called Julia.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Here she is at Findagrave: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=71200732 and her obituary: "Julia Littell, 95, Widow of Gen. Alexander M Patch, who commanded the Americal Division in Guadaicanal and the U.S. 7th Army in Europe in World War II, died in San Antonio, Texas, September 25. Mrs Patch was the daughter of Brig. Gen. I.W. Littell of Elizabeth, N.J. and Julia Barrett Littell of Baltimore. The Littells were stationed on Governor's island when Mrs. Patch met her future husband. She was an alumna of Oaksmere in New York. Mrs. Patch is survived by one daughter, Mrs. Chandler Diehl of San Antonio, and three grandchildren."

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: We'll fix spelling of her name in title.
